review: I just want Blizzard to go back to making games like they use to, but I dont think that will ever happen, I wish I could say RIP to all the Blizzard IPs I grew up with, but I know its just a matter of time till Modern Blizzard, or Lizzard as some people call them because they only take L's, disturbs the graves of the IPs and necromances them back to life in a hallowed state, a false visage reproduction pretending to be what they were only to milk them dry for whatever they can.

Overwatch 2 gets a lot of hate, but a lot of it is in my opinion undeserved.
The Overwatch 2 team is one of the best teams when it comes to listening to the players and implementing regular balance patches that keeps the game fresh. There's a lot of fun to be had here.
better than tf2

Apartado de blizzard aclarando porque harán un overwatch 2 y cerrarán el 1: Queremos crear una experiencia nueva implementando un PvE más desarrollado incluyendo un modo historia para expandir mucho más su lore y conocer más a profundidad todos sus personajes

Proceden a CANCELAR todo ese proyecto en 2023

Literalmente ahora se puede decir que es el mismo juego con un 2 para que quede bonito siendo prácticamente lo mismo que el 1 solo que con un pase de batalla y a la fecha 2 modos de juego nuevo. Y que ahora es 5v5 en vez de 6v6

I'm tired of battle passes and over priced skins, and servers for Overwatch 1 shut down so I don't have an option to play that instead. I used to love Overwatch, but all the micro transactions are ruining my experience. I still sometimes play with friends, but can't help but feel bitter that unlocking skins and emotes is near impossible without spending money. I wish the battle pass was like Halo Infinite, where there isn't a time limit to complete all the tiers. Since I don't play this game often enough, I wouldn't get my money's worth.

I'm a Beta player since 2016. Currently 3,600 hours played at the time of writing (4,000 counting my other few accounts) 

This used to be my dream game but over time they ruined every aspect I loved:

-going 5v5 and losing a tank on each team

-absolute ANNIHILATION of the matchmaker. Now every match is "your turn to win/your turn to lose" stomp simulator. It doesn't matter how good or bad you play, the matchmaker decides. Most matches end up with team 1 having 5 total elims and team 2 having 80+

-removing borders and account levels

-removing lootboxes and going free to play

-charging 20 to 25$ per skin (the premium ones used to be 10, and OWL skins 3)

-replacement of Jeff, the ending of developer updates and devs talking on forums

-abandonment of PTR and experimental card

-cancellation of skill trees and hero missions

-Insultingly low premium currency from doing weeklies (240 coins per month. Consider that premium skins are 2000 to 2500 coins. Yeah it will take you a little under a year of nonstop weekly challenges to earn 1 single free shop skin.

Is there some good? Yes. Graphics and gameplay are top tier in the industry and still what keeps me coming back, it just feels good to play heroes. No other hero shooter has ever reached this level of polish. It's just a shame Blizz disrespects the consumer so badly compared to how OW1 used to be

Still, I will recommend it to new players since it is free and there would be a ton for you to unlock, which is an aspect I enjoy about these kinds of games, PROGRESSION, something that has been missing for a very long time

I have hundreds of hours on the original Overwatch, & I gotta say it was pretty damn good. It was fun, had a great cosmetic system that allowed you to get everything for free as long as you were patient, non predatory loot boxes, & hope for a story mode

Started playing the game since beta, the game was great for years but the company in their infinite wisdom decided to switch gears and slowly let it bleed out. What started as a game full of hope and excitement, slowly devolved into a slow pain train of despair.

Slow content releases caused the game to go stagnant, the shift from no limits (some say good, some say bad) kind of choked the freedom and imagination from the creative team plays. Some different metas went by, some characters added with questionable gameplay mechanics. Which slowly funneled and solidified into the GOATS comp meta which pretty much clamped the game into a very repetitive game style (which was both boring to watch and play). 

With the company narrowly focused on the pro league and letting the little fish slowly die out instead of balancing the game, the population of the game dipped hard. 

They employed every type shady method of attention seeking to drive some player numbers back. The junkass seasonal game modes, that don’t get updated and are recycled every season. Another dirty maneuver was when they pretty much pulled the Kevin Spacey’s “I’m gay” moment, which was coming out and pushing the soldier 76  was gay narrative, probably to drum up some public notoriety and in hopes of pulling the lgbt community to its defenses (no offense to the lgbt community, we were all being used). 

As the player numbers was close to flat lining, they finally came out and announced Overwatch 2 and its future pve plans. Revealing that they were hard at work, working on it this whole time while we were slowly bogged down with Ow1 pvp. This did bring a general interest and some excitement back to the game, but what did we get instead?

Overwatch 2 was basically a DLC that reduced a crap ton of features when they switched over to the “new” engine to make things look “nicer” (everyone plays on lowest settings to get a proper edge in comp..). The gameplay was further reduced from 6v6 to 5v5, in some ways it fixed the GOATS hell we were all stuck in, but introduced other unforeseen issues such as the boring ass Tank rock-paper-scissors gameplay, and a whole host of character ability problems that were still built for 6v6. Our seasonal updates were what? The reimplementation of the missing features that were already there in Ow1 on release.

There was no need for Ow2 to cannibalize Ow1, which it did (felt like wc3 reforged all over again). What was tweaked to it’s utmost perfection? The cash shop, everything was in your face. Gone were the days where you played to get rewarded with loot boxes, it was predatory as hell, and a total gateway to gambling (spent sum $$$ yeah...), but it was still better than the system we got in ow2. Now it was all low effort battle passes, different currency types, and pretty low tier loot drops. 

What’s worse is, Call of Duty, another Bliz title literally has battle passes containing enough Cod points to let you work towards the next battle pass. Giving players incentive to keep playing to get the full bang out of their buck (cmon man…).

The switch to f2p was an interesting choice, the player population increased, but then they canceled pve. The main reason for switching to overwatch 2 was for the pve promise, and some “upgrades” that came with it. Without that, people have once again started to quit in droves, even the game influencers are slowly waving the white flag and abandoning the game. 

Now that they’ve been forced to place their game on Steam, you know the internal figures are probably not looking good. Some may agree this was a good move, but they’re definitely hoping to siphon some of the numbers from steam public over to their game. Just gonna log in and get my achievements, and log out cuz this games future looks really bleak.

TLDR - Core games fun, but Activision Blizzard’s decision-making drove the game to the ground.

[h1] 好评 [/h1]
守望先锋2因为看了雾子的CG入坑的, 十五年暴雪老玩家, 守望游戏时间目前大约450小时
澳服

[b] 优点 [/b]
1. 不怎么花时间, 每局10-15分钟
2. 画面是我的菜, 并且有很丰富的背景设定
3. 从第四赛季开始英雄平衡做的挺不错, 目前是第六赛季了, 希望能保持
4. 开发团队更新的态度是积极的, 值得肯定的, 比隔壁D4的更新好到不知道哪里去了

[b] 缺点 [/b]
1. 出英雄的速度不够快, 但是还是可以接受的
2. 皮肤卖的有点贵
3. T位要求太高了也有点过于重要了, T拉跨直接全队拉跨, 其他位置玩起来比较开心

因为是澳服所以没有国服那么多事儿, 也不开公屏聊天, 体验挺好的. 大部分时候和朋友在Discord语音.

总体来说是一个很好的游戏, 新人入坑的话推荐关闭公屏交流, 尽量不要从T开始玩, 应该会获得不错的游戏体验.

imagine buying a house.  Could use some work but over well was a nice house.  Then you are told several years later sorry we have to demolish it, but don't worry we will replace it with a newer and better one.  However, it keeps getting delayed but don't worry it will come.  Eventually you move into your new house along with some of the new features and expansions.  You find your new house is worse than the old one and you wish you could get your old one back. Unfortunately though there is no going back, but don't worry they will fix all that later along with everything else they promised.  A while later you find they aren't delivering the new stuff after all and didn't intend to for quite some time.... BTW you are left having to pay for the new expansions and features of your new house too.

This is what happened to OW2.  Blizzard is a former shadow of its former self and so is this game.  There are better FPS games out there.

I'm sorry, I used to love Overwatch so much, but this is not Overwatch anymore.

Starting from the beginning, I supported this game since OW1, but I see Blizzard spit on all the people who bought it for . Where's the free content, heroes? Everything was promised. The missions were supposed to be free because that's why you did OW2 for, but now you want 14,99€? For unfinished shit? These missions don't even have half of what you promised, but you backed out.  All you did was battlepasses and new skins. This game had a lot of potential - characters, story, gameplay, unfortunately wasted for now.  Even after all this, I supported you that maybe it wouldn't be so bad. But I was wrong, this update is the worst you've ever done because you showed how much players mean to you. Nothing. Walking wallets. I don't understand people who buy these missions. It's a waste of money for unfinished content (they did it for a couple of years). 
It's not the players' fault that this game dies once again, it's yours. I hope someday you, Blizzard will understand your mistake and fix it.

I feel like I installed the wrong version, why are all the characters wearing clothes?

Overwatch 1 was one of my favorite games of all time, it still is. PEAK Overwatch 1 was so much fun, and I was really hoping Overwatch 2 would capture that fun I had when I first played the original. Sadly, that is not the case. Overwatch 2 was invented solely for the PVE, and that has since been scrapped for a barebones version you can buy for 15 dollars. 3 missions for 15 bucks doesn't seem worth it, and from what I've watched and read, it seems like a glorified archives event, which was free in OW1. PVP was very unbalanced for a while, with some of the changes being questionable. Balance has gotten much better since launch, but it still could be better. I do prefer 5v5 to 6v6, but that totally could have been an update to OW1. The amount of content this game had on launch was laughable, and I'm sure we would have the same amount of content we do now if OW1 continued to receive updates post 2019. Monetization is horrible. 20 dollars for a skin is NOT worth it in the slightest, and the battlepass, while OK now that it has some sort of currency in it, is still the worst battlepass in any game like it. I really really want to like this game again and have a passion for it, but in it's current state it's not what was promised, and it's not what we should settle for
